data.title: Nice bar, good food, local taps
data.text: So I needed dinner and I was driving around in Pontiac, saw this place so swung in for a try.  The beer was cold, and local which is always a nice change, and the food was tasty.  I had a California club sandwich; nice grilled breast of chicken, bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and a toasted bun.  I will definitely go back on my next trip to this part of Michigan.

data.title: Good grill
data.text: Great burger.   I love burgers and this place had a good burger for me to enjoy.  I told my friends and people come a good way to enjoy this places food.

data.title: Great place with attentive staff
data.text:
Downtown 51 is a great place, especially for lunch.  Their salads and sandwiches are all great with a wait staff that is friendly and on top of it.

It was a great place to have a business lunch.

data.title: Fast food, friendly staff, close to concert venue
data.text: We were greeted with a friendly smile & open seating. Menus were delivered promptly. We ordered appetizers (endame  had interesting spice-yummy) Our order arrived fast & hot! Perfect for the teenagers to grab a bite before the show.

data.title: Don't go unless you have a lot of time on your hands
data.text: We arrived for lunch on a weekday around 11:45.  We were a little concerned as we were the only one's there besides a couple of people sitting in the bar area.  Our waitress took our drink orders and food orders in a nice timely manner.  As the noon hour came around, more people came in.  Actually, a lot more people came in.  Turns out the bartender, hostess, and waitress are all the same person.  She was working alone!  It didn't take long for her to become frustrated with customers asking for more water, how much longer the wait would be, etc.  My particular table had asked for individual receipts.  Mind you, there were only 4 people in my group.  I think that threw her over the edge.  Every time we  asked her something she nastily said "its going to be a few minutes".  Anyway, our food was quite good.  Maybe a bit pricey for the area but regardless, it was good!  The fries were to die for.  We all commented on how good they were.  This place could be a real goldmine if they had decent staffing.  Until then, you won't see us back there.  Pontiac is not known for its booming downtown so its obvious the people dining there are most likely working in the area.   Working customers typically don't have more than 1 hour for lunch and when we do sit down for lunch, its to relax, not get attitude.
